rule.description: The REF policy for open access is only applicable to conference or journal publications.
rule.resolutionHint: Please change the RIOXX type of this item to Conference Paper/Proceeding/Abstract or Journal Article/Review.

fieldValue.description: Conference Paper/Proceeding/Abstract
Journal Article/Review

rule.description: Conference proceedings are only applicable if they have an International Standard Serial Number (ISSN)
rule.resolutionHint: If you want your submission to be REF applicable, please fill in the ISSN number that corresponds to the uploaded conference proceeding.

fieldValue.description: Conference Paper/Proceeding/Abstract

rule.description: REF applicable submissions have to be accepted after or on 2016-04-01.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the date of acceptance is correct.

fieldValue.description: 1 April 2016

category.name: Deposit Requirements
category.description: To be deposit compliant, the item must have all the correct metadata and it must have been deposited as soon after the point of acceptance as possible.
category.resolutionHint: If you cannot meet the deposit requirements, then please select a deposit exception in the submission form.

rule.description: A compliant deposit must have at least one file.
rule.resolutionHint: Please upload the author's accepted and final peerreviewed text to this item.

rule.description: The version of the text must be the author's accepted or the (corrected/enhanced) peerreviewed text.
rule.resolutionHint: Please change the RIOXX version (rioxxterms.type) of this item to Author Manuscript (AM) or Version of Record (VoR).

fieldValue.description: Accepted Manuscript
Proof
Version of Record
Corrected Version of Record
Enhanced Version of Record

rule.description: The output must have been deposited as soon after the point of acceptance as possible, and no later than three months after this date.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the date of acceptance (dcterms.dateAccepted) is correct. If your publication was accepted before 2017-04-01, you can alternatively fill in the print publication date (dc.date.issued) or online publication date (refterms.dateFirstOnline) if the publication happened less than three months before the deposit date.

rule.description: During the first year of the policy (before 1 April 2017), outputs can be deposited up to three months after the date of print publication instead of the date of acceptance.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the date of acceptance and publication are correct. If your publication was accepted before 2017-04-01, you may also fill in the first online publication date (refterms.dateFirstOnline) if the publication happened less than three months before the deposit date.

rule.description: The publication was accepted before 2017-04-01.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the date of acceptance is correct.

fieldValue.description: 1 April 2017

rule.fieldDescription: time between print publication and deposit

rule.description: During the first year of the policy (before 1 April 2017), outputs can be deposited up to three months after the date of first online publication instead of the date of acceptance.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the date of acceptance and first online publication are correct. If your publication was accepted before 2017-04-01, you may also fill in the print publication date (dc.date.issued) if the publication happened less than three months before the deposit date.

rule.description: The publication was accepted before 2017-04-01.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the date of acceptance is correct.

fieldValue.description: 1 April 2017

rule.fieldDescription: time between first online publication and deposit

rule.description: The output is unable to meet the deposit requirements or the output is being made open access via another route. In the event of audit, the institution must be able to provide proof justifying the exception.
rule.resolutionHint: Please select a deposit exception in the submission exception step.

fieldValue.description: The individual whose output is being submitted to the REF was unable to secure the use of a repository at the point of acceptance
The individual whose output is being submitted to the REF experienced a delay in securing the final peer-reviewed text (for instance, where a paper has multiple authors)
The individual whose output is being submitted to the REF was not employed by a UK HEI at the time of submission for publication
It would be unlawful to deposit, or request the deposit of, the output
Depositing the output would present a security risk
The output was published as 'gold' open access (e.g. RCUK-funded projects where an open access article processing charge has been paid)

category.name: Discovery Requirements
category.description: To be discovery compliant, the item must be presented in a way that allows it to be discovered by readers and by automated tools such as search engines.

rule.description: The item must be discoverable and searchable by anonymous users.
rule.resolutionHint: Please make sure that the item is not withdrawn and that there are no resource policies on this item that prevent it from being discoverable.

rule.description: An item can only be discoverable if it has been fully archived in the repository.

category.name: Access Requirements
category.description: To be access compliant, it must be possible for anyone with internet access to search electronically within the text, read it and download it without charge, while respecting any constraints on timing but without too much delay.
category.resolutionHint: If you cannot meet the access requirements, then please select an access requirements exception in the submission form.

rule.description: If no embargo applies, the publication must be openly accessible as soon as possible and no later than one month after deposit.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify that the date of first compliant deposit is correct. If this is not the case, contact your DSpace administrator.
rule.fieldDescription: time between the compliant deposit and the first open access availability

rule.description: In the case of an item released under embargo, the item must be openly accessible no later than one month after the end of the embargo period.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify the embargo end date.
rule.fieldDescription: time between the embargo end date and the first open access availability

rule.description: When the target REF panel is A, the embargo period must not exceed 12 months.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the embargo end date of the primary bitstream is correct and that the selected target REF panel matches your publication.

rule.description: When the target REF panel is B, the embargo period must not exceed 12 months.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the embargo end date of the primary bitstream is correct and that the selected target REF panel matches your publication.

rule.description: When the target REF panel is C, the embargo period must not exceed 24 months.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the embargo end date of the primary bitstream is correct and that the selected target REF panel matches your publication.

rule.description: When the target REF panel is D, the embargo period must not exceed 24 months.
rule.resolutionHint: Please verify if the embargo end date of the primary bitstream is correct and that the selected target REF panel matches your publication.

rule.description: The deposit of the output is possible, but there are issues to do with meeting the access requirements. In the event of audit, the institution must be able to provide proof justifying the exception.
rule.resolutionHint: Please select an access exception in the submission exception step.

fieldValue.description: The output depends on the reproduction of third party content for which open access rights could not be granted (either within the specified timescales, or at all)
The publication concerned requires an embargo period that exceeds the stated maxima, and was the most appropriate publication for the output
The publication concerned actively disallows open-access deposit in a repository, and was the most appropriate publication for the output

rule.description: The output is unable to meet the criteria due to a technical issue. In the event of audit, the institution must be able to provide proof justifying the exception.

fieldValue.description: Output is a conference proceeding, but not within definition (i.e., it does not have an ISSN, or the proceedings are published as part of book series)
At the point of acceptance, the individual whose output is being submitted to the REF was at a different UK HEI which failed to comply with the criteria
The repository experienced a short term or transient technical failure that prevented compliance with the criteria (this should not apply to systemic issues)
An external service provider failure prevented compliance (for instance, a subject repository did not enable open access at the end of the embargo period, or a subject repository ceased to operate)

rule.description: In very exceptional cases, it may not be possible for an output to meet the open access requirements set out by this policy for a reason not covered by the other exceptions and a short explanation for this is provided. In the event of audit, the institution must be able to provide proof justifying the exception.
